subject: Drive: Refactor Drive property request functions
commitMessage:
Drive: Refactor Drive property request functions

Refactor the drive resource and reorganized the code.

Tested:

Passed Redfish Validator with no new error.
```
*** /redfish/v1/Systems/system/Storage/storage0/Drives/drive0
         Type (#Drive.v1_7_0.Drive), GET SUCCESS (time: 0.307086)
         PASS
```

```
{
  "@odata.id": "/redfish/v1/Systems/system/Storage/storage0/Drives/drive0",
  "@odata.type": "#Drive.v1_7_0.Drive",
  "Id": "drive0",
  "Name": "drive0",
  "Status": {
    "Health": "OK",
    "HealthRollup": "OK",
    "State": "Enabled"
  }
}
```

Change-Id: Iceba90b39bd2d7a423c7fae03760b81a8e010606
Signed-off-by: Willy Tu <wltu@google.com>

Patch Set 12:

Tested with the following Inventory Manager config:

    events:
    - name: Creating Drive at startup
      description: >
          Create /system at startup and populate the AssetTag property with
          empty string.
      type: startup
      actions:
          - name: createObjects
            objs:
             /DrIv3/mYsUpErSyStErnDr1v3:
                xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Item.Drive:
                  Type:
                    value: "xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Item.Drive.DriveType.SSD"
                    type: string

Test commands:

    $ curl --insecure -H "X-Auth-Token: $token" -X GET https://${bmc}/redfish/v1/Systems/system/Storage/1/Drives/mYsUpErSyStErnDr1v3
    {
      "@odata.id": "/redfish/v1/Systems/system/Storage/1/Drives/mYsUpErSyStErnDr1v3",
      "@odata.type": "#Drive.v1_7_0.Drive",
      "Id": "mYsUpErSyStErnDr1v3",
      "MediaType": "SSD",
      "Name": "mYsUpErSyStErnDr1v3",
      "Status": {
        "Health": "OK",
        "HealthRollup": "OK",
        "State": "Enabled"
      }
    }

Patch Set 25:

(2 comments)

Please see other places in bmcweb where we do enum -> redfish conversions.  This is generally not what we prefer;  instead, we generally use dedicated methods with if/else ladders, because they compile smaller.
Done
This should be settting InternalError, as dbus is publishing a type that doesn't exist.
Done
This should be combined with the call on line 439 to use the GetAll method, which decreases the number of calls, and the code.

They are under the different interface

`xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Item.Drive`

vs.

`xyz.openbmc_project.State.Drive`

---

The one in Item.Drive is still WIP... so maybe we can move it? but it make more sense being in Item.Drive.
Ah...... makes sense.
Ack

But Type is a property on this interface.. 
I think this should be an internal error as well

I have added it.

Just curious,

Do we generally don't want to be compatible with platforms using older version of phosphor-dbus-interface? like we can assume that all system have the latest interfaces supported.

This is a very subtle question, with a complicated answer.  In theory, any change to phosphor-dbus-interfaces should come with the changes to make all the daemons compatible with the new interfaces, so in practice, in upstream, we generally can assume interfaces are "correct".  There might be cases where we take a shortcut if say, there's a lot of daemons to fix to add a new interface and the changes will get merged over time, but in general, it's very helpful if bmcweb can flag interface failures so that they show up in peoples tests.
ack. thanks for the info. Yeah, sounds like a good indicator to let other people know there has been an update and force them to keep up to upstream. Panic -> action??
internal error?
Done
Typically this is a separate method
I have moved it to a different method and use optional to help check if it is valid. Maybe just checking for empty sting good enough.?
we've done both in the past, either would be fine.  My personal preference is std::optional, because it's brutally obvious what the behavior is, but I know my opinion isn't hte only one out there.

ok, sounds good. I just like optional because it looks cool.

I am not familiar with the performance impact of it compared to not using it. Unless there are strong opinion against it. I will just leave it.
Ack
std::optional<std::string> I have been told explicit type are more more clear
Done
This looks wrong.  Lack of a drive interface isn't an error.
Done
Just use !driveType to match other places.
Done
Please use *driveType to match other places.
Done
This method is getting to the point where it needs broken up.  As is it's too long.
I have refactored all of the function in requestDrive.

If I understand correctly, object2->second is a list of interfaces, and they are set by the ObjMgr and named a bit differently:
(https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-objmgr/blob/2b7789c0180e9678909407df2c195dd3191dfc68/src/main.cpp)

        Type                                  Name in this CL     Name in ObjMgr
    1)  vector<pair<string, vector<string>>>  connectionNames     interface_map_type::value_type
    2)         pair<string, vector<string>>>  connectionNames[0]  interfaceMap
    3)         (the string in the pair)       connectionName      service name
           
For the names #1 and #2: the pair<string, vector<string>> is named "interface map"
in ObjMgr, maybe rename "connectionNames" to "interfaceMaps"?
For #3 it seems "DBus connection name" is usually equal to "DBus service name"
so that looks good and do not need to be changed.

sure. I will change connectionNames to interfaceMaps.

It was just in other functions and I just didn't change it.
nit, extra braces.
Done

do we need to do anything to asyncResp? don't we need messages::internalError(asyncResp->res);?
what will be the response in this case? can you test and paste the result here?

These properties are not required, so we should not error out if it is missing.

The `PartNumber`, `SerialNumber`, ... will just not be in the output.

nit:
You can use std::holds_alternative and avoid the use of pointer variable.
Done. Thanks.
shouldn't you log this error too?
Done
don't we need messages::internalError(asyncResp->res);?
same comment as above. The property is not required, so no error requried.

nit:

don't we need &driveId?
we can't use a reference to `driveId`, since driveId might be out of scope before we get to use it. So we need to create a copy.
give actual type
Use meaningful names.
Done

Tried 
```
crow::openbmc_mapper::GetSubTreeType::iterator drive =
...
```

And got this error

```
../redfish-core/include/../lib/storage.hpp:395:37: error: conversion from ‘__normal_iterator<const std::pair<std::__cxx11::basic_string<char>, std::vector<std::pair<std::__cxx11::basic_string<char>, std::vector<std::__cxx11::basic_string<char> > > > >*,[...]>’ to non-scalar type ‘__normal_iterator<std::pair<std::__cxx11::basic_string<char>, std::vector<std::pair<std::__cxx11::basic_string<char>, std::vector<std::__cxx11::basic_string<char> > > > >*,[...]>’ requested
  395 |                         std::find_if(
      |                         ~~~~~~~~~~~~^
  396 |                             subtree.begin(), subtree.end(),
      |                             ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
  397 |                             [&driveId](
      |                             ~~~~~~~~~~~
  398 |                                 const std::pair<
      |                                 ~~~~~~~~~~
  399 |                                     std::string,
      |                                     ~~~~~~~~~~~~
  400 |                                     std::vector<std::pair<
      |                                     ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
  401 |                                         std::string, std::vector<std::string>>>>&
      |                                         ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
  402 |                                     object) {
      |                                     ~~~~~~~~~
  403 |                                 return sdbusplus::message::object_path(
      |                                 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
  404 |                                            object.first)
      |                                            ~~~~~~~~~~~~~

      |                                            ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
  406 |                             });
```

We not checking greater than 1 in line 470. 
is line 470 correct? if so, correct this message.
Done

nit:
do we need a more specific message here?
Also moves a bunch of code around.
Done

This would be easier to review if this was 2 commits:
commit 1: move the code: e.g. move getDriveAsset, getDrivePresent, etc. 
commit 2: add MediaType
I agree with Gunnar, could you do so?
sorry for the delay. I have cleaned it up bit more now. I have moved the MediaType change to the next review.
Ack

Please don't do this.  We use the pointer mechanism all over the place to good result, and to my understanding, holds_alternative gives no advantages, and possibly has a problem with get<> generating unwind tables for an exception that can never happen (although one would hope the optimizer could see that).

If this is a pattern we want to do other places, that's fine, push a separate patchset with the advantages of this way, and we can have a discussion on whether or not changing is a good idea.

in the interim, this patchset should be using get_if
sounds good. I have removed it now.

FYI, this is still incorrect, as it's assuming that the connection that hosts the drive object is the same one as hosts the asset, present, and state interfaces.  WIth that said, this was incorrect before, so that's ok.

oh it is?

Since we are forcing the connection to only be one, I guess that is also wrong.

I guess we want to add all of the different interfaces to the object mapper and use the filename() to find the driveId and go from there instead.

```
std::array<const char*, 1>{
                    "xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Item.Drive"}
```

and the one with `xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Item.Drive` will have the existing function without the asset, present, and state.

Maybe something like https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/48832?
